verses.text: We give thanks to you, O God, we give thanks, for your Name is near; men tell of your wonderful deeds.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 75
rsbNotes.text: Ps. 75 The theme of casting down the wicked and lifting up the righteous is also found in Hannah’s song (1 Sam. 2:1–10) and Mary’s words of praise (Luke 1:46–55).

rsbNotes.title: Ps 75:1
rsbNotes.text:
75:1 We. The psalm begins as a communal thanksgiving, though at the end an individual speaks for the community.

name. See Ps. 8:1.

your wondrous deeds. God’s great acts in history (Rev. 15:3, 4).

verses.text: You say, "I choose the appointed time; it is I who judge uprightly.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 75:2
rsbNotes.text: 75:2 judge with equity. God’s judgments are always just, and He knows the secrets of the heart.

verses.text: When the earth and all its people quake, it is I who hold its pillars firm. Selah

rsbNotes.title: Ps 75:3
rsbNotes.text: 75:3 keep steady its pillars. God provides the underlying stability of the world order.

verses.text: To the arrogant I say, 'Boast no more,' and to the wicked, 'Do not lift up your horns.
Do not lift your horns against heaven; do not speak with outstretched neck.'"
No one from the east or the west or from the desert can exalt a man.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 75:4
rsbNotes.text: 75:4 horn. This common metaphor is one of a powerful horned beast proudly lifting up its head in defiance and anger. God warns the wicked not to act in this way against Him.

verses.text: But it is God who judges: He brings one down, he exalts another.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 75:7
rsbNotes.text: 75:7 it is God who executes judgment. God and not any person in the east, west, or south determines what shall stand.

verses.text: In the hand of the LORD is a cup full of foaming wine mixed with spices; he pours it out, and all the wicked of the earth drink it down to its very dregs.
As for me, I will declare this forever; I will sing praise to the God of Jacob.
I will cut off the horns of all the wicked, but the horns of the righteous will be lifted up.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 75:8
rsbNotes.text: 75:8 a cup. See note Ps. 11:6.
